description: The Bank of Canada (BoC) will not be introducing a digital currency any time soon. After researching and holding public consultations on the idea of a central bank digital currency, the BoC said it will be shifting its focus away from the concept. “With this work completed, and with other payments issues gaining prominence, the […]
title: Bank of Canada Abandons Plans to Develop Digital Dollar

description: Pushing people to enter the “overheated” housing market is a bad idea, an expert says, with new data finding first-time buyers want to purchase property as soon as possible. A report has affirmed Australians are eager to join the home-ownership ladder during a week of jockeying in federal government over how best to help buyers. […]
title: Overheated Market Could Burn First-Time Home Buyers

description: China’s anti-subsidies investigations into brandy, pork, and dairy shipped from the European Union (EU) are “unwarranted” and “lack sufficient evidence,” the bloc’s trade commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis said on Sept. 19. Dombrovskis conveyed this message during a meeting with his Chinese counterpart, Wang Wentao, who visited Brussels in an effort to stop the imposition of extra […]
title: China’s Probes Into EU Pork, Brandy, and Dairy Are ‘Unwarranted’: EU Trade Chief Says

description: Liberal and Tory top party executives testified at the Foreign Interference Commission on Sept. 20, saying that current rules and procedures in their parties protect against meddling by foreign actors. The Conservative Party allows citizens and permanent residents aged 14 and older to purchase a membership. Meanwhile the Liberal Party allows anyone who ordinarily resides […]
title: Executives of Liberal, Conservative Parties Respond to Nomination Loophole Concerns at Inquiry

description: Immigration Minister Marc Miller defended his government’s security measures as MPs questioned the federal government’s security checks for visa and immigration applicants following recent arrests in alleged terrorism plots. Miller was appearing at the House public safety committee to testify on how a Toronto man arrested this month for allegedly plotting an ISIS attack in […]
title: MPs Question Immigration Minister About Security Checks After Recent Wave of Foiled Alleged Terrorist Plots

description: Taiwan has been excluded from United Nations agencies, such as the World Health Organization, due to China’s opposition.
title: Nine Countries Urge UN to Allow Taiwan’s Participation

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: A Transient Sandbank, Historic Jewelry

description: Brazil's Supreme Court has fined Elon Musk's X more than $921,000 for violating a ban by temporarily restoring user access.
title: Musk’s X Hit With Fines After Platform Reappears in Brazil Despite Ban

description: Multiple rallies were held in major cities across Canada, including in the nation’s capital, as part of the second “1 Million March for Children” event, advocating for parental rights. Pickering city Coun. Lisa Robinson, who attended the Sept. 20 event in Toronto, said many parents are upset about Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity (SOGI) material […]
title: Annual ‘1 Million March’ Rallies Across Canada Demand Parental Rights

description: Three men have been injured after a 24-year-old man entered a mosque southwest of Montreal armed with a knife. Police in Châteauguay, Que., on Montreal’s South Shore, say the three men were in their fifties and suffered only minor injuries, with one transported to hospital. The suspect entered the Muslim cultural centre in Châteauguay Friday […]
title: Three Men Injured After Man Enters Montreal-Area Mosque Bearing a Knife

description: Veteran Australian political cartoonist Michael Leunig reflects on his 55-year newspaper career, and his plans for the future.
title: Losing the Freedom to Laugh in the Age of Woke: Cartoonist Leunig Reflects on 55-Year Career

description: Analysts say Beijing’s latest move to pressure the United States to curb arms sales to Taiwan has no real effect.
title: China Sanctions 9 US Firms Over Arms Sales to Taiwan

description: An IDF airstrike killed Ibrahim Aqil while he met with other senior commanders in an underground bunker outside Beirut.
title: Israel Says It Has Killed Top Hezbollah Commander

description: The Royal Canadian Mint has issued a special $2 coin in honour of the 100th anniversary of the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF). The coin features images of aircraft that have played significant roles in the RCAF over the last century. It began circulating as of Sept. 18, according to a release from the Mint. “On […]
title: New Toonie Honours Royal Canadian Air Force’s 100th Anniversary

description: The NDP is asking the Competition Bureau to investigate whether Canadian corporate landlords are using the same AI software that sparked an antitrust lawsuit in the United States. The U.S. Justice Department filed the lawsuit last month against real estate software company RealPage Inc., accusing it of an illegal scheme that allows landlords to co-ordinate […]
title: NDP Asks Competition Watchdog to Probe Potential Rent-Fixing by Corporate Landlords

description: Quebec’s public security minister says he’s shocked by reports that a 14-year-old boy’s death southeast of Quebec City is linked to organized crime. François Bonnardel was reacting to multiple media reports that the body of a teenager from Montreal was found near a Hells Angels bunker in Frampton, Que., about 50 kilometres southeast of Quebec […]
title: Quebec Minister Accuses Organized Crime of Using 14-Year-Old ‘To Do Their Dirty Work’

description: Report by Cancer Research UK says cancer rates are soaring and more than 300,000 patients will not receive early treatment without more investment.
title: Cancer Charity Says More Money Needed to Meet Treatment Targets

description: Uptick in violence comes after the US captured cartel boss Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada in July.
title: Mexican President Blames US for Upsurge in Cartel Violence in Sinaloa

description: More than half of employees regularly check work emails outside of work hours and 39 percent have responded to work-related messages while on holiday.
title: UK Experiencing ‘Epidemic’ of Long Working Hours, Says Health and Safety Experts

description: Law associations across the country are criticizing the Manitoba NDP’s decision to remove from caucus a backbencher linked to the lawyer defending convicted sex offender Peter Nygard. Legal organizations at both the national and provincial levels are urging Premier Wab Kinew to reconsider his decision to expel Mark Wasyliw from caucus. They are also demanding […]
title: Legal Groups Urge Manitoba NDP to Restore Ousted Backbencher

description: There were 19,498 migrant encounters recorded between border posts along the northern border between October 2023 and July 2024.
title: US Border Patrol Apprehends Record Number of Migrants Crossing From Canada

description: Tensions reached a boiling point between NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh and Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre during question period in the House of Commons on Sept. 19, after Singh announced his party would not back the Tories’ non-confidence motion against the Liberal government. During his opening round of questions in the House of Commons, Poilievre criticized […]
title: Poilievre, Singh Engage in Heated Exchange in House After NDP Says Won’t Support Non-Confidence Motion

description: The European Commission determined the tax breaks gave foreign companies an unfair advantage.
title: EU High Court Rules UK Tax Scheme for Multinational Companies Did Not Breach State Aid Law

description: Ukraine’s intelligence chief, Kyrylo Budanov, said Russian spies were able to access the personal messages of Telegram users, including deleted messages.
title: Ukraine Bans Telegram App From All State-Owned Devices

description: The intense barrage followed attacks earlier in the week that blew up Hezbollah radios and pagers, which Hezbollah attributed to Israel.

description: Press conference hears from team representing 37 women who claim they were raped and assaulted by the billionaire Harrods owner, who died last year aged 94.
title: Lawsuit Alleges Harrods ‘Enabled’ Alleged Abuse by Mohamed Al Fayed

description: A major car lobby is urging Brussels to act on EU green targets, but a policy expert believes the body is unlikely to retreat from its climate legislation.
title: European Automakers Urgently Seek EU Policy Change Amid Plummeting EV Demand

description: The University of Ottawa’s special adviser on anti-Semitism resigned following criticism for posts he made on social media praising a wave of deadly pager explosions in Lebanon. Thousands of pagers used by Hezbollah members in Lebanon detonated simultaneously on Sept. 17, killing twelve people and injuring thousands. The following day, a second wave of attacks […]
title: Ottawa U’s Special Adviser on Anti-Semitism Apologizes, Resigns After Posts Praising Pager Explosions in Lebanon

description: Nearly two years of disciplinary hearings for a Toronto Catholic school board trustee have wrapped up, with final comments focused on free speech and its limitations. The Ontario College of Teachers brought Mike Del Grande before a tribunal in hearings starting November 2022 for comments he made about gender identity and abortion in 2019. Del […]
title: Toronto Catholic School Trustee Makes Free Speech Case for LGBT, Abortion Comments

description: The story of a 25-year-old Ontario student who became addicted to hydromorphone–a potent opioid–after getting access to diverted government-funded “safer supply” pills is the subject of a new documentary released this week. The film, “Government Heroin,” was produced by the Center for Responsible Drug Policy, an organization that promotes recovery-oriented drug policy. Released Sept. 17, […]
title: New Doc ‘Government Heroin’ Tells Story of Ontario Student Hooked on Safer Supply Drugs

description: Statistics Canada says retail sales rose 0.9 percent to $66.4 billion in July, helped by stronger new car sales. The agency says sales were higher in seven of the nine subsectors it tracks with sales at motor vehicle and parts dealers up 2.2 percent, boosted by a 2.3 percent increase in sales at new car […]
title: Statistics Canada Reports Retail Sales up 0.9% at $66.4B in July

description: A day before the official start, British Columbia’s election campaign sees B.C. Conservative Leader John Rustad and Green Party Leader Sonia Furstenau speaking to municipal leaders, while NDP Leader David Eby is gearing up to get his campaign bus rolling. Eby spoke to local politicians yesterday at the Union of B.C. Municipalities convention, as they […]
title: BC Election Campaign Starts Saturday; but Eby Takes Bus on Test Run, Rustad at UBCM

description: New Domestic Abuse Protection Orders include expanded powers to forbid abusers from contacting victims and harsher punishments for those who break them.
title: Domestic Abuse Specialists to Be Embedded in 999 Control Rooms

description: The head of Via Rail repeatedly told MPs a train delay over the Labour Day long weekend was an isolated incident, despite a similar event two years ago. Mario Péloquin appeared in front of a parliamentary committee Thursday to answer to an incident between Montreal and Quebec City that stranded passengers for 10 hours as […]
title: Labour Day Train Delay Isolated Incident, Via Rail CEO Tells MPs

description: Bank of Canada governor Tiff Macklem says there is a lot of uncertainty around how artificial intelligence could affect the economy moving forward, including the labour market and price growth. In a speech in Toronto at the Economics of Artificial Intelligence Conference, the governor said Friday that the central bank is approaching the issue cautiously […]
title: Bank of Canada Trying to Figure out How AI Might Affect Inflation, Macklem Says

description: Half of the war-torn nation's energy infrastructure has been destroyed and rolling blackouts leave parts of the east in darkness for four hours at a time.
title: EU Commissioner Visits Ukraine As Bloc Pledges 160 Million Euros for Winter

description: Commentary In an era where certain segments of the population have settled on the phrase “systemic racism” to describe all kinds of individuals, organizations, and even entire countries (some have called Canada itself systemically racist), it is hard to get any neutral, fact-based words in edgewise. That racism is an unfortunate part of our species, […]
title: Wiretaps Are Serious Law-Enforcement Tools and Are Not Handed Out Easily

description: The president of Gold Apollo has been questioned by prosecutors in Taiwan in connection with the pagers which exploded in Lebanon on Tuesday.
title: Taiwan Says Exploding Pager Components Were Not Produced on Island

description: MEXICO CITY—An attempted prison break early Thursday in Honduras left two inmates dead and three injured, authorities said. The Latin American country has long been plagued by gang violence and overcrowded prisons. According to officials, a total of 72 prisoners took part in the attempted escape from the men’s prison in the town of Tamara, […]
title: Attempted Prison Escape in Honduras Leaves 2 Inmates Dead and 3 Injured

description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands—One person was killed and another seriously wounded in a stabbing incident late Thursday in the Dutch port city of Rotterdam, police said. Police arrested a suspect who was also injured. Police spokesman Wessel Stolle said officers were investigating the stabbing near the landmark Erasmus Bridge. Stolle said there was no immediate word […]
title: Police Say 1 Person Killed, Another Seriously Wounded in Stabbing in Rotterdam

description: Australia is on La Niña watch, but weather models suggest the cooler, wetter conditions could swing back to neutral.
title: Australia Braces for Sizzling Summer Despite La Niña Speculation

description: Deadly contamination from the mining of blue asbestos at Wittenoom in WA has spread outside a 46,000 hectare management zone, the group says.
title: Aboriginal Group Take Asbestos Contamination Fight to the UN

description: Hobart has recently invested $1.8m in its CCTV network, which police now have dual access to.
title: Tasmania’s Capital Expands Surveillance With 330 ‘Eyes on the Ground’

description: The coalition government will replace one law with two, which it says will make it easier to build everything from a house major infrastruture.

description: Solicitors for both Igor and Kira did not oppose the prosecution's request for more time, nor did they apply for bail.
title: Court Hears Spy Allegations Against Russian Migrants to Australia

description: Alberta has rolled out an $8.6 billion plan to speed up the building of new schools–public, private, and charter–in response to rising student enrolment driven by rapid population growth. The new School Construction Accelerator Program will create more than 200,000 new student spaces over the next seven years, the province said in a Sept. 18 […]
title: Alberta’s $8.6B New Schools Plan Will Fund Charter and Private School Construction as Part of ‘School Choice for Parents’

description: Amid threats of a Hezbollah retaliation after the targeted attacks on the terrorist group’s communication devices, White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said at a Thursday press briefing that the Biden administration still believes a diplomatic resolution between Israel and Hezbollah “is achievable.”
title: Despite Recent Escalation, White House Says Diplomatic Resolution Achievable in Middle East

description: Although over half of Canadians are considering starting a business, most current business owners question whether now is a good time to become an entrepreneur, according to recent statistics. An RBC poll shows 51 percent of Canadians are thinking of launching a business, up five percentage points from 2023, according to a Sept. 18 news […]
title: 50% of Canadians Thinking of Starting a Business, But Most Business Owners Say Don’t

description: Employment Minister Randy Boissonnault says the ethics commissioner has concluded he broke no rules after three probes into allegations he was involved in business dealings while in cabinet. He adds that he regrets his association with his former business partner. “While I have always followed my ethical obligations, it is clear in hindsight that this […]
title: Minister Boissonnault Says Ethics Commissioner Cleared Him for Third Time

description: The increase in job numbers, almost double what was forecast, is positive news for the unemployed, but may diminish expectations of an RBA rate cut.
title: Job Growth May Impact Mortgage Rates and Borrowers

description: Bowen has timed his piece two days before Dutton is expected to speak before the Committee For Economic Development of Australia about his nuclear plans.
title: Minister Says Opposition’s Nuclear Plan Could Cause 49 Percent Electricity Shortfall by 2035

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: An Unfinished Basilica, A Luxury Embroidery

description: The Crown is asking the Federal Court to dismiss a class-action lawsuit by Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) members who say they were harmed by the COVID-19 vaccine mandates, arguing the claims are insufficient and there are adequate alternative remedies for the plaintiffs. “We’re not talking about the individuals or what they’ve gone through,” said government […]
title: Court Hears Motion to Dismiss Class-Action Lawsuit Against Military’s Vaccine Mandate
